awd_titl_txt: Summer School in Dynamical Systems at Maryland
awd_abstract_narration:
Abstract(Kaloshin,1402759): 

This award provides funding to help defray the expenses of 25 graduate students studying dynamical systems in the U.S and one of the proposed lecturers for an advanced  "Summer School in Dynamical Systems at Maryland" to be held on the campus of the University of Maryland in College Park from August 18-25, 2014.

There will be talks given by the PI, 2 other well-known faculty working at Maryland in dynamics, some postdoctoral fellows, and an outside research mathematician. All are established experts in the field.  There will be 4 mini-courses on topics of current interest, mainly drawn from hyperbolic and Hamiltonian dynamics. This program will train 25 U.S. graduate students in some important topics and problems in dynamical systems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The Summer School in dynamical systems was attended by nearly fifty participarts from different parts of US and of the world. It was a great sucess in disseminating recent progress in this field to graduate and undergraduate students. Four intense courses

by D.Dolgopyat on Hyperbolic sawtooth map

by B. Fayad on Quasiperiodic dynamics

by A. Gorodetski on Selected applications of hyperbolic dynamics,

by V. Kaloshin On billiards on a convex region and inverse spectral problems

served as an introduction into four active areas in dynamics. The courses were suplemented by discussion sessions. Several introductory lectures by postdocs, Backes, Corsi, Kudriashev, Lima, Vinogradov, gave students a flavour of other hot topics in dynamics. The school aslo stimulated wide range of intercations among participants. There was an active poster sessions, which stimulated a lot of discussions. At the end of most lecture days there was informal discussion session. Some of these discussions started joint projects, others shared their research interests. Some number of undergraduate students applied and were accepted to soome graduate schools. Some of these graduate students are planning to do study dynamical systems. The experiense received in organizing these school is very helpful and we hope to have a similar school in a near fufure. One forthcoming possibility is at MSRI in the summer of 2017.
